body_html:
Yes, on Windows 10 with Visual Studio 2017 15.5. By the way, my local build had just completed successfully.

Do you have any reason to use Bazel instead of CMake to build pip package?
Building Tensorflow with Bazel on Windows is still very experimental.

Do you have any reason to use Bazel instead of CMake to build pip package?
Building Tensorflow with Bazel on Windows is still very experimental.
body:
Yes, on Windows 10 with Visual Studio 2017 15.5. By the way, my local build had just completed successfully.

Do you have any reason to use Bazel instead of [CMake](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/cmake) to build pip package?
Building Tensorflow with Bazel on Windows is still very experimental.
